segmentation: Hello my name is Alyssa Chick from BT research and venturing and this is a talk about introducing knowledge access insects.
OK, So what is knowledge access?
Well really it's about delivering knowledge to the user.
About providing tools to give access to the users to one or more knowledge basis, and this could be tools such as a search interface, it could be a knowledge sharing system.
It could be a system that summarizes knowledge and presents it to the user in an easy to understand way, or it could be a visualization.
So viewing a 2D or 3D view of the knowledge in a way that allows the user to grasp a large set of knowledge base really quickly.
So some problems exist with knowledge access systems today.
For example, information overload we're bombarded with knowledge coming from all sorts of different sources.
It's difficult to keep on top of that knowledge to pick out which is the most important Nuggets from all the information that's coming to US search engines today.
Suffer from high recall and low precision now by this.

By high recall, I mean that you get a lot of information back, not all of it is relevant and low precision means you don't necessarily get all of the relevant information delivered to you, so you miss out on some of the knowledge that's important to you.
Again, syntactic searches imprecise, so when you're typing in a query into a search engine, you're just using words and relying on the search engine to match those words with the knowledge.
Now obviously there's words can be ambiguous, so it's difficult sometimes to find the right information.
There's also a high cognitive load, but by this I mean you have to stop what you're doing and then go to another application to try and find out.
So to a query it's not really spliced into your your current thought.
Your current application usage and finally knowledge.
Access generally isn't contextually aware, so it's not aware of what you're working on at the moment.
Is not aware of your surroundings.
And the best way to deliver knowledge to you at a particular point in time.
So now.
Access insect is attempting to address some of these issues.
One of the key things it's doing is integrating some of the low level technologies in the project, such as the Human language Technology Knowledge Discovery and ontology and metadata management.
It's providing access to the users to the knowledge that's discovered by these technologies.

So what we're aiming to do is produce context aware tools for access to semantically annotated knowledge, and we're doing this by providing tools that allow you to search, browse, visualize, summarize, share, and infer knowledge.

So that you don't have to change applications or change focus to find out particular piece of knowledge.
